page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: Most of the farms have many buildings 11-20 including the farmhouse. The houses tend to be old most dating from land enclosures in the 18th C. The Henstead Estate was sub-divided and sold to the tenant farmers after World War 2. Fields tend to be large and most have hedgerows. Copses are used for rearing game birds. Acreages vary from approx 350-700, making for large farms given over mainly to arable. Soils are mixed, ranging from light sandy loams to heavy boulder clays, the result of glacial drift. In the river valley are peaty soils waterlogged in winter. There are on average 4 men per farm. Farming is capital intensive making much use of machinery and all the farms have workshops. Wheat is the predominant crop, while recent changes include the phasing out of peas & increase in rape
